official_title: Randomized Phase II Trial of Pembrolizumab and Radiation vs. Radiation and Concurrent Chemotherapy for High-Grade T1 Bladder Cancer (PARRC Trial)
brief_title: Testing the Addition of the Immunotherapy Drug, Pembrolizumab, to Radiation Therapy Compared to the Usual Chemotherapy Treatment During Radiation Therapy for Bladder Cancer, PARRC Trial
cancer_type_display: A study comparing immunotherapy plus radiation to chemotherapy plus radiation for patients with high-grade T1 non-muscle invasive bladder cancer.
cancer_tags: Recurrent Non-Muscle Invasive Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma
Stage I Bladder Cancer AJCC v8
prior_treatments_excluded: Prior systemic chemotherapy or immunotherapy for urothelial carcinoma
No prior treatment with anti-PD-1, anti PD-L1, anti PD-L2 or anti-CTLA4 antibody
No history of pelvic radiation therapy
site_name: AIS Cancer Center at San Joaquin Community Hospital

key_inclusion_summary: Pathologically proven diagnosis of T1 high-grade non-muscle invasive urothelial carcinoma of the bladder without nodal or metastatic disease (N0, M0).
Must have high-risk disease, defined as recurrence after BCG, presence of lymphovascular invasion or variant histology, or persistent T1 disease at restaging TURBT.
A restaging TURBT must be performed and all grossly visible papillary tumors must be removed.
Adequate organ function (hematologic, renal, and hepatic).
key_exclusion_summary: Evidence of regional nodal disease or metastatic disease.
Prior systemic chemotherapy or immunotherapy for urothelial carcinoma.
Active autoimmune disease that required systemic treatment in the past 2 years.
Diffuse carcinoma in situ or prostatic urethral involvement.
